label: 神部
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Hereditary corporations (be) made up of households (ko) whose tax of rice on paddy fields (so ), commuted taxes (yō ), and tribute in kind (chō) were paid to the officials of the Shintō shrines to whom the households belonged, and who tilled the shrine rice fields (shaden) of those same shrines. [戸、租、庸、調、神道、社田]
